conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C, we need to analyze the process on a pressure-volume (P-V) diagram.
The process from B to C involves a horizontal line, indicating constant pressure.
The pressure at state B and state C is 0.6p0.
The volume changes from V0 to 0.5V0.
The work done W by the gas during a process at constant pressure is given by the formula: W = P ΔV.
The negative sign indicates that the work is done on the gas (the gas is compressed), rather than by the gas.

premise: The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
conclusion: The work of magnitude 0.3p0V0 is done on the gas.
